answers_data.content:
Hi Rob, does the NoScript "S" button list show any other sites blocked while using Gmail?

Is Firefox applying Tracking Protection to Gmail? When content is being blocked, Firefox displays a "shield" icon toward the left end of the address bar, next to the i-in-a-circle icon. This article has the details about this feature and how to make exceptions: Tracking Protection in Private Browsing.

If those don't resolve it, could you allow third party cookies and then reload the page:

network.cookie.cookieBehavior = 0

Any luck?

data.content:
Hi all, I visited this site https://www.privacytools.io/ and upon its advice adjusted most of the following: 

   privacy.trackingprotection.enabled = true
       This is Mozilla’s new built in tracking protection.
   geo.enabled = false
       Disables geolocation.
   browser.safebrowsing.enabled = false
       Disable Google Safe Browsing and phishing protection. Security risk, but privacy improvement.
   browser.safebrowsing.malware.enabled = false
       Disable Google Safe Browsing malware checks. Security risk, but privacy improvement.
   dom.event.clipboardevents.enabled = false
       Disable that websites can get notifications if you copy, paste, or cut something from a web page, and it lets them know which part of the page had been selected.
   network.cookie.cookieBehavior = 1
       Disable cookies
       0 = Accept all cookies by default
       1 = Only accept from the originating site (block third party cookies)
       2 = Block all cookies by default
   network.cookie.lifetimePolicy = 2
       cookies are deleted at the end of the session
       0 = Accept cookies normally
       1 = Prompt for each cookie
       2 = Accept for current session only
       3 = Accept for N days
   browser.cache.offline.enable = false
       Disables offline cache.
   browser.send_pings = false
       The attribute would be useful for letting websites track visitors’ clicks.
   webgl.disabled = true
       WebGL is a potential security risk. Source
   dom.battery.enabled = false
       Website owners can track the battery status of your device. Source
   browser.sessionstore.max_tabs_undo = 0
       Even with Firefox set to not remember history, your closed tabs are stored temporarily at Menu -> History -> Recently Closed Tabs.

I also installed: uBlock Self Destructing Cookies HTTPS Everywhere Disconnect NoScript

Now I've disabled most of the extensions for when at GMail. I've told NoScript to allow Google etc and it all works fine except for typing in the TO field and the compose area of Gmail.

Can anyone offer any advise as to which of those settings could be causing the grief?

Thanks so much for your help.

Rob

answers_data.content: Within the 'Local Folders' folder, you should find some files which have no suffix, which have the same names as folders within 'Local Folders' (e.g. 'Inbox', 'Sent'). These files should contain all the stored messages and should be in mbox format. You can open them with a simple text editor and you should see all the messages concatenated into a single list. There is more information about the file structure here: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Profile_folder_-_Thunderbird under the heading 'files and folders in the profile'.

data.title: Mihin on hävinnyt aiemmat postit?

answers_data.content: Many email providers (Gmail is one) have a default setting which automatically places a copy of every sent mail in the Sent folder. Thunderbird also has this setting (in Account Settings > Copies & Folders). If Thunderbird is making a copy of every message you send and your email provider is doing it too, then you can experience the delay you mention and the duplication of copies in the Sent folder. The solution is to turn off one of the functions. In my Gmail setup, for example, Thunderbird is set not to save a copy of sent mail, but I get a copy in the Sent folder anyway because Gmail puts it there.

data.content: For my email I use the program Thunderbird which is a Mozilla product. Before replacing my hard disk, to send email was fast and was automatically recorded in my ‘sent file’. Since I replaced by hard disk, Thunderbird has a new (?) but certainly bad feature in sending emails. It sends the email to the internet, but then in a separate function copies the sent email to the ‘sent" folder ‘which is a slow process and often I get an error message. So I do it again. When I look in the sent folder both copies are there., I haven't found a solution yet. The Help messages don't help and I haven't found a way to talk to someone at Thunderbird yet. I can not believe this is an intended feature or the program. If I do not find a resolution to this problem I will most probably drop Thunderbird.

To update it to 47.0.1, open the 3-bar menu > Help (question mark at bottom right) > About Firefox. Alternatively, you can press the Alt key to bring up the main menu bar > Help > About Firefox. answers_data.content: You may have two copies in the Sent box, but that just means two copies: it doesn't mean the mail has actually been sent twice. If possible, check with the recipient to see if they have received it twice. If they haven't, and you're just getting two copies of sent mail, the most likely explanation is that one is being created by Thunderbird and one is being created by your email provider. In Thunderbird, go to Account Settings > Copies & Folders and see if 'automatically place a copy of sent messages in ... [folder]' is selected. If it is, unselect it, close Thunderbird and restart. Then send yourself a test message: if you end up with only one copy, your problem is solved.

answers_data.content: They should be saved, yes. Thunderbird stores messages, contacts etc (the user data) in a folder called a 'profile'. It's in a different location to the program. When you reinstall the program, it looks in the default location for a profile folder, and if it finds one already there it uses it. (if it doesn't, it creates a new blank profile.) For peace of mind you can backup the profile on external storage like a memory stick (that's good practice anyway). Then you can install the latest Thunderbird and, if necessary, copy the profile back on to your computer. Instructions are here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-tb

DO animated gifs on web pages use up more data?

If you don't know what you need Java for, uninstall it altogether via the Windows Control Panel.

This add-on basically provides a GUI to easily enable or disable certain plugin functions. It doesn't block anything, it just turns of the functionality.

See above. If you don't know how to use it, remove it.

and what's the difference between these? (ie., what does each one do?) )

Gifs , Flash, Javascript are part of websites you're viewing. Flash is primarily used for videos and for serving ads. Javascript is usually an essential part to make a website work. It's not recommended to block it when you don't know what you're doing, because that would render a whole lot of websites useless. That's why the GUI to disable Javascript has been removed from Firefox. QuickJava restores that GUI.

Javascript is also used by advertising networks for tracking purposes. These scripts don't provide anything useful for the users viewing the web page, but they can really suck up your data quota.

I'd recommend to install an adblocker like AdblockPlus. https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/adblock-plus

Make sure to subscribe to a filter list upon the first start. A number of lists are suggested and you can chose what you want. You can add filter lists at any time later.

That alone should already reduce your data consumption. And it's much more friendly to the eye without ads.

Once upon a time, an animated GIF was just a compressed image file that contained numerous image frames and some timing information.

The SuperStop page on the Add-ons site says:

SuperStop is very simple: it adds a Shift+Esc shortcut that stops active WebSocket connections, XMLHttpRequests, and any animated images, regardless of the state of the Firefox Stop button.

The first two items refer to background connections that retrieve additional content from websites, while the third refers to traditional animated GIFs. I don't think SuperStop stops Flash (or HTML video) from playing.

SuperStop and Flashblock work in the opposite way: SuperStop provides a new way to stop animating images, while Flashblock stops Flash by default and you can start it when you want to start it. Note that neither of these stops videos that are delivered through an HTML5-based player.

coatli said

what are "videos that are delivered through an HTML5-based player"?
how would i know when i come across them?
and is there a good app or recommended method to stop those?

Websites can embed a video in a page using a variety of methods, including these HTML tags:

<embed> => causes Firefox to use a plugin <object> => causes Firefox to use a plugin <video> => causes Firefox to play the video itself (HTML5 player)

Since these HTML tags are not visible to you when the page loads, it's difficult to tell which one is the source of the black rectangle/player. If you right-click the player area, if the context menu doesn't identify a specific plugin, most likely it's Firefox's built-in HTML5 video player.

I am not aware of any method to prevent Firefox from loading HTML5 video if the page is set to auto-play it. Firefox has a preference to stop it from playing (media.autoplay.enabled), but the video is still buffered even though playback is paused. Therefore, that setting is not very helpful for your needs. Maybe you can find a different add-on.

data.content: In English words have to be separated by spaces even if you use them together as composite concept. For example the concept "spelling check" is a composition of spelling and check. In Dutch those words should be spelled without space: "tekstcontrole" is correct, "tekst controle" isn't. The Firefox spell check is only recognizing the separate words (tekst and controle) and is underlining the contraction (tekstcontrole) as incorrect when in fact only the latter is correct. This is not an exception, in fact most sentences have such words, so using the Firefox spelling check in Dutch always results in lots of red lines.
data.title: Dutch spelling check not taking into account contractions of words belonging together

It is not not Firefox that supports Extensions but the Extensions authors that support Firefox.

The Visited extension author has a comment for Firefox 47.0 users https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/visited/

Extensions generally do not get impacted by a new major Firefox update however on occasion they do and the extensions that get affected usually gets a update when the authors can.

The vast majority of extensions at addons.mozilla.org are by a third-party author or company as those done by Mozilla would have say Mozilla or Mozilla Labs as the author for example.

The extension author posted this suggestion:

"If you use Firefox 47, please use Visited Lite instead. (Update soon)" https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/ad.../versions/

Visited Lite is a user script, which is a lightweight add-on you run using the Greasemonkey extension. Unfortunately, you have to set it up from scratch, it can't copy over your preferences from Visited.

If you want to try it, there are two steps:

(1) Install Greasemonkey: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/greasemonkey/

A link will appear to restart Firefox to activate Greasemonkey, then

(2) Install the Visited Lite script: https://greasyfork.org/en/scripts/15173-visited-lite

To edit the color used by the script, you can open it from the Add-ons page. Either:

  • Ctrl+Shift+a (Mac: Command+Shift+a)
  • "3-bar" menu button (or Tools menu) > Add-ons

In the left column, click User Scripts. Then on the right side, right-click > Edit the Visited Lite script and that will open it in an editor. Note: if it gets broken during editing, you can repeat step #2 above to restore the original.

Hopefully the author will fix the extension soon!

Hi Chris,

If you are still following this question and have any further comments. Or if there is anything we may be able to offer advice and help on, relating to this issue, please post back again.

Thanks John


Forum Note I am going to mark this as solved. (That is actually against the forum guidelines but I feel it is appropriate in this instance ) The OP is no longer responding, but did point out this sort of issue could be important to (colorblind colourblind)1 8% of the population so marking it solved because that makes it easier for those people to find some sort of an answer.

data.content:

Like 8% of the men worldwide I am colour blind and cannot see which site I have visited except with "Visited". The latest edition of Firefox has removed this option.

What total arrogance !!!

It is also VERY difficult to contact you and make my feelings known. Wasted a lot of time before I got here!!

How can you totally ignore such a large section of your clients and still not do anything.

What total arrogance !!

Goodbye and I will take my money and flase belief elsewhere

Chris

answers_data.content:
re: Second image is in safe mode all worked as it should,

This makes me think one of the addon extensions is causing a conflict. Do the following to find out which one.

Start in normal regular mode. 'Tools' > 'Addons' Disable one addon extension. Restart Thunderbird

If still a problem then you know the disabled addon extension is not causing a conflict.

Repeat - disable one more addon extension and restart TB..repeat until it works ok, then you know which addon extension is the problem.

If this is caused by an addon, it might need updating or perhaps the addon is not compatible until the author fixes it. The author should be told about the issue.

Please tell us the addon extension that caused the issue.

Safe mode also turns off hardware acceration.

Menu icon > Options > Options > Advanced > General tab uncheck 'Use hardware acceration when available' click on OK

Restart Thunderbird and report back on results.
here is the image
Disabled hardware acceleration same thing as before

What OS are you using ?

Please confirm : In normal start mode, after disabling one addon extension, did you restart Thunderbird to test ? Then disable another addon and restart Thunderbird to test? etc

It is not enough to just disable, you have to restart afterwards.


re : same issue in version 45, 47 and 49, Exit Thunderbird. If you did the above testing correctly, please uninstall whatever version you are using and make sure there are no other versions installed. Start > Control Panel > Programs and Features select Thunderbird and click on uninstall

I'm not sure where you downloaded those versions from as 45.2.0 is the current release. Some are obviously beta versions.

Then download and install from this link, selecting the language of preference and download for your OS.

data.content:
FF makes some funny choices in the dropdown URL select menu that slows me down almost every time It selects the second best match rather than the best... An example will help

If I want to open Google maps, I type map... and the autofill shows maps.google.com and the top item is also "visit maps.google.com". This is what I want.

HOWEVER, instead of "visit maps.google.com" being highlighted, the second item in the list is highlighted, which is a specific address I searched for several years ago. If I just type m-a-p <return> it takes me to this specific address. What I have to do is type m-a-p and then mouse or arrow to the preferred 'visit...' item in the list.

This is peculiar... you would think that it would select the most generic item rather than the most specific? I've tried several of the switches in the 'browser.urlbar.suggest' category and none seem to change this behavior. Is there a preference to change it?

answers_data.content:
Please check your Firewall, which might be part of your Anti-Virus product.

Thunderbird program needs to be allowed else the firewall will block it from accessing internet.

So you need to check this is all working ok first.

Close Thunderbird. Access firewall. Make sure Thunderbird is allowed. Restart Thunderbird.

On one occassion I had to block it, ok it and then access again and set it to allow. Sometimes, the firewall does not seem to recognise that an update is the same program.
I still get the same error, Thunderbird failed to find the settings for you email account. previously it found all the settings very quickly, now it simply fails.

If it's failing to find the settings, that suggests that you are using the automatic account set up wizard? That function tries to look up the settings in a database of common email providers (Gmail, Hotmail and so on). But the database is neither exhaustive nor always up-to-date, and when Thunderbird can't find your provider listed it returns a 'failed to find settings' message. I suggest you go to the email provider's website and check what the account settings should be. Then create the account manually in Thunderbird, copying all the settings exactly.

I'm responding under the impression that you already had mail accounts set up.

Uninstalling and reinstalling Thunderbird would not have made any difference as it not a problem with the Thunderbird Program itself.

Are you trying to add mail accounts ? When you reinstalled Thunderbird, did it pick up the old profile and display the mail accounts even if they still cannot access server?

Can you see the mail accounts in the left Folder Pane ? If yes, then please post the following information: In Thunderbird Help > Troubleshooting information click on 'Copy text to clipboard' in this forum question, right click in a 'Post a REply' text box and select 'Paste'. You can remove/edit all info on fonts and printers but nothing else.

When you right-click Sent - Properties, a window pops up. Please provide a screenshot of that window.

Did you create backups of your Thunderbird profile? If not, now would be a good time. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-tb#w_backing-up-a-profile

Attached please find the screenshot of what shows after I right-click the folder Sent -> Properties.

I have backed up my profile

The 'Saved Search Folder' dialog certainly isn't what we're looking for. I have no idea why you get it instead of the 'Properties' pop-up. So something is severely broken.

As a workaround: At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button , then select Help > Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Open Folder.

This will open your Thunderbird profile in Windows Explorer. Navigate to 'Mail' (assuming this is a POP account) - your account folder. Close Thunderbird. Delete the file Sent.msf. Start Thunderbird.

The account is a POP account.

I did delete the Sent.msf as suggested above but after re-starting the problem still remains. I am unable to view anything in my sent and draft folders. All other folders are ok.

When I click on properties after re-starting I again get the 'Saved Search Folder.'

I also opened the 'Mail' account folder after re-starting. The Sent.msf does not show up anymore.

Normally Thunderbird recreates the .msf file upon start-up. However, it's possible anti-virus software is blocking access to your Sent file. Windows safe mode disables anti-virus software.

Therefore, try to start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled. - Win10 http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/change-startup-settings-in-windows-10#v1h=tab01 - Win8 http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-8/windows-startup-settings-safe-mode# - Win7 http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows7/Start-your-computer-in-safe-mode

Still in Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in safe mode. - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/safe-mode

Has the Sent.msf file been created now? Do you get access to the Properties window?

Looking at the size of your mail files: Inbox 1.5 GB Sent 3.1 GB That's significant. Accumulating messages in Inbox (and Sent) is asking for trouble. It's probably just a matter of time until you'll see the same problem with Inbox.

Anti-virus software takes a long time to scan large files. That happens every time you receive or send a message, i.e. all the time. Access to those files is blocked for Thunderbird while they are scanned. Furthermore, it's not uncommon that anti-virus corrupts those files. As a result messages can get lost.

To remedy that, follow these steps: Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. http://kb.mozillazine.org/Profile_folder_-_Thunderbird

Don't let your anti-virus software scan incoming and outgoing messages.

Don't let your anti-virus software scan attachments.

Don't let your anti-virus software intercept your secure connection to the server.

Remove any add-ons your anti-virus software may have installed in Thunderbird.

Keep it working. http://kb.mozillazine.org/Keep_it_working_-_Thunderbird

Copy the file Sent to a new file and name that new file e.g. Troubled. Start Thunderbird. This should produce a new folder 'Troubled'. Did Thunderbird create a file Troubled.msf greater than 0 bytes? I did as stated above, and copied the sent folder. Then renamed it 'Troubled.' When I restarted the 'Troubled' folder showed up and so does a Troubled.msf file greater than 0 bytes. My Sent e-mails that were copied now show up in this folder. The folder also gives me a repair option.

However, as you can see the Inbox.msf shows up a 0 bytes and there is no Sent.msf file. My Sent folder still does not show messages and I am not sure how to deal with this in the future? My Inbox also does not show messages when I re-start. I have to download a message from the server (POP) and then I get a message 'Building Summary file for Inbox'. Once this completes I can view my messages in the Inbox.

Both the Inbox and Sent folders do not give a repair option when I right click -> Properties. Inbox shows: 'Edit Saved Search Properties for Inbox' window Sent shows: 'New Saved Search Folder' window

I do not know what to do going forward?

Do all of the following while still in Windows safe mode.

Leave 'Troubled' alone for the time being.

Close Thunderbird.

Create a new full backup of your Thunderbird profile.

Using Windows Explorer navigate to the 'Mail' folder in your profile and delete The files Sent and Sent.msf.

Restart Thunderbird.

Right-click on your account name and select 'New Folder...'.

Enter Sent as folder's name and confirm by clicking on 'Create Folder'.

You should now have a working Sent folder. Send a test message and verify the message gets copied into the new Sent folder.

Also verify Properties for Sent and that is has a corresponding Sent.msf file with a size greater than 0 bytes.

If this all works you can repeat the entire procedure for Inbox. Make sure not to overwrite 'Troubled', as this now has all your previously sent messages. So when you copy Inbox to a new file rename it to a different name than 'Troubled'.

Is your account set up for Global Inbox? At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button > Options > Account Settings > Server Settings > Advanced.

Hi, there is only one account.

I have attached the screenshot as you requested.

It appears your account is set up for Global Inbox. That means your mail folders are created underneath 'Local Folders'. For a single account that doesn't really make sense. http://kb.mozillazine.org/Global_Inbox

As usual, create a backup of your Thunderbird profile.

Then set the account not to use the Global Inbox, select either "Inbox for this server's account" or "Inbox for different account" and click "OK".

That should create a new folder underneath 'Mail' for your account, and create a new file 'Inbox', 'Inbox.msf', 'Sent', and 'Sent.msf'.

Verify whether you can send and receive mail normally. Then make sure the files were properly created, the size isn't 0 bytes, and you can get to 'Properties'.

answers_data.content:
Well you managed to post a question from Firefox in the end.

Are you able to follow these instructions and post two or three Crash IDs, post them from an alternative browser if it is easier.

We're sorry to hear that Firefox is crashing. In order to assist you better, please follow the steps below to provide us crash IDs to help us learn more about your crash.

The crash report is several pages of data. We need the report numbers to see the whole report.

  1. Enter about:crashes in the Firefox address bar and press Enter. A Submitted Crash Reports list will appear, similar to the one shown below.
  2. Copy the 5 most recent Report IDs that start with bp- and then go back to your forum question and paste those IDs into the "Post a Reply" box.

Note: If a recent Report ID does not start with bp- click on it to submit the report.

(Please don't take a screenshot of your crashes, just copy and paste the IDs. The below image is just an example of what your Firefox screen should look like.)

Thank you for your help!

More information and further troubleshooting steps can be found in the Firefox crashes - Troubleshoot, prevent and get help fixing crashes article.
I tried what you said and nothing happened.
Are you there?
Hello
I told you that does not work. Nothing happens.

Sorry you need to give people time to answer. I am off to a real money paying job now. I think you may have tried 

about crashes

or some variation of that instead of 

about:crashes

Note it is all small letters - fancy name is lower case. Do not use the Shift or Caps Lock key. There is no space between the words but there is a colon - the two dots one on top of the another.

about:crashes
https://crash-stats.mozilla.com/about/throttling

John posted:

Note: If a recent Report ID does not start with bp- click on it to submit the report.

Not every crash report is automatically submitted. Click on an un-submitted report to send it to the Crash server. Then when that reported 'gets' the bp- added to it, give us that Crash ID string (letters & numbers).

Hi   Yorri   !
Is Firefox open,   but just not responding to anything you try  ?
If that's the case,   you may be facing a   hang   and not a crash.
Greetings,
Happy112.
The screen goes all white with an exclamation mark in it or everything freezes including shut down icons. Firefox takes about 4 mins to load when I first open it.
John do you mean on this screen here?

Hi again Yoriri, Did you manage to get the details from about::crashes

If you do see crash IDs that start with bp- please paste some of those in to your next reply. If they were not there last time you checked they may now have appeared. if there are no submitted crash reports begining with bp- at least try to capture a screenshot of what you do see. Then attach the screenshot using the button uncer where you type that says Add images: [Browse... ]

I am not sure I recognise the description of going white with an exclamation mark. I doubt you can get a screenshot of that but can you try to describe it in more detail please. Is it the crash reporter ?

  • Mozilla Crash Reporter

The image above may not be exactly what the current crash reporter looks like, but it will have similar content and wording. Is that what you sometimes see ?

Please also try starting Firefox in its safe mode, and with you disabling all the plugins, by setting them to never activate..

  • Troubleshoot Firefox issues using Safe Mode
  • Disable or remove Add-ons

Does that help at all ?

Also have a look at these articles

  • Firefox hangs or is not responding - How to fix
  • Adobe Flash plugin has crashed - Prevent it from happening again

Sorry if we are not being very helpful. I am afraid I am not yet sure what you are seeing, and so I am not able to give the best advice.
You are right I cannot get a screen shot. There is no crash reporter either.
Thanks, Looks like at least two of those were submitted, I will look at them if I can and get back to you in this thread in a few minutes,

OK those are both FlashPlayer crashes.

Can you try as i suggested in an earlier post and use Firefox in its safemode and with all plugins including FlashPlayer disabled. With look it will not then crash.

If it does crash when you do that try to get the crash reports for the new crashes see if thy help any more.


Are you trying to deliberatly use FlashPlayer ? or is it just in use for adverts and video clips that you do not really need ?

Forum note

  • Your Crash Reports
    bp-0e95dc61-b909-4018-afb5-3b7602160723
    bp-6ba86731-2208-4142-94e7-dbddc2160723
  • Crash Signature: F_655494733_______________________________________

Flash player crashes are not always too easy to resolve.it may turn out it is not possible to watch some videos on certain sites without problems. Or there may be things that may help if changed.

  • Adobe Flash plugin has crashed - Prevent it from happening again
  • Flash Plugin - Keep it up to date and troubleshoot problems

I note a module 

HookTitle.dll

I will try to look that up. No idea what it is or whether it is a problem. And I note you must use some Kaspersky software

I am trying to play online game. I don't really know what a flash player is or what it does. I am not watching any videos. Also I keep getting a pop up box with something about plugins. But I am not a tech and have no idea what is what. All I want to do is enjoy my game. So frustrating. The guys who I play game with said use Firefox because I was getting similar problems with IE. My game used to load in Chrome. But now in Chrome its useless. I was really hoping that Firefox was the answer to my problems.
That file HookTitle is probably ok. Is the computer an Asus make ?
Asus Pro 31p

I am not in to gaming. Some games may well use FlashPlayer.

Do you only use browsers like Firefox and Chrome to play games ? Or do you sometimes use them for browsing the web ? or related activities, such as using webmail or facebook & twitter.

Chrome actually has FlashPlayer effectively built in to it and so may be a better choice for games that need FlashPlayer, but you say your game has stopped working with that.

What is the game and the games website address ?

FlashPlayer is described by wikipedia as 

'Adobe Flash Player (labeled Shockwave Flash in Internet Explorer
and Firefox) is freeware software for using content created on the
Adobe Flash platform, including viewing multimedia,
executing rich Internet applications, and streaming video and audio.
http://lp.empire.goodgamestudios.com

I use Chrome for Facebook. Do not do too much browsing. Just a little. But like I said I spend more time trying to fix problems on this pc than getting things done. I have windows live mail picking up 3 different emails.

I am going offline now. I will leave you to read some of the articles I linked and try to answer my questions..

No need to try to do screenshots at the moment. I will assume that your only problem is FlashPlayer crashes.

Did you try your game with Internet Explorer ? Note if the game needs FlashPlayer on Firefox it will need FlashPlayer on Internet explorer, but you need to install Flashplayer separatly on Internet Explorer.

To install FlashPlayer on Internet Explorer use Internet explorer to visit the Adobe site and follow their instructions http://www.adobe.com/software/flash/about/

Goodnight.
Yes the game does need FlashPlayer.
Finally I got a screenshot of 1 of the problems.

A beérkező levelekben kapott linkeket nem tudom megnyitni.A linkre kattintás után a keresőben beindul a keresés amit lehet látni. Bizonyos idő eltelte után a keresőben megjelenik a háromszög sárga alapon egy felkiáltójel,és Problema az oldal betölté.. szöveg A megjelent oldalon ez látható: A kapcsolódás sikertelen

A Firefox nem képes kapcsolatot létesíteni a(z) listmanage-71.com helyen lévő kiszolgálóval. 

   A webhely ideiglenesen nem érhető el vagy túlterhelt. Próbálja újra pár perc múlva.
   Ha semmilyen oldalt nem tud letölteni, ellenőrizze a számítógépe hálózati kapcsolatát.
   Ha a számítógépet vagy a hálózatot tűzfal vagy proxy védi, ellenőrizze, hogy a Firefox számára engedélyezett-e a webhozzáférés.

Előre is köszönöm a segitséget.
